item.title: GST council defers tax cut on insurance premiums as Nirmala Sitharaman awaits IRDAI feedback - Hindustan Times
item.description:
GST Council Defers Tax Cut on Insurance Premiums

Date: Dec 21, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Goods and Services Tax (GST) council deferred the decision to cut tax on insurance premiums as many inputs including IRDAI comments are awaited. Additionally, the council clarified taxi regulations on popcorn taxation.

  • The GST council did not approve a tax cut on insurance premiums pending IRDAI feedback.
  • Clarification issued that pre-packed ready-to-eat snacks will face a 12% tax.
  • Tax on caramelised popcorn is set at 18% without changing the existing popcorn tax rate.
  • A group of ministers (GoM) will be formed to address Andhra Pradesh’s demand for a calamity cess on luxury goods.
"The cess will be on luxury items and state-specific levy," said Andhra Pradesh Finance Minister Payyavula Keshav.

This decision reflects ongoing considerations in adapting taxation to address current needs while awaiting further input from key stakeholders.

item.title: Six-storey building collapses in Punjab's Mohali, several feared trapped - The Times of India
item.description:
Six-storey building collapses in Punjab's Mohali, several feared trapped

Publication Date: 2023-10-19 | Source: Times of India

This tragic incident occurred when a six-storey building in Mohali, Punjab collapsed, leading to fears that several individuals may be trapped under the rubble.

  • The building collapse happened early in the morning.
  • Rescue operations are currently underway, with local authorities and emergency services on the site.
  • Eyewitnesses reported hearing a loud noise before the structure fell.
  • Authorities are investigating the cause of the collapse.
“We are doing everything possible to rescue those trapped under the debris,” stated a local official.

The community is in shock over this event, and ongoing efforts are being made to ensure that all possible safety measures are taken in future constructions.

item.title: Poll Rules Tweak Makes Electronic Records Harder To Get, Sparks Row - NDTV
item.description:
Poll Rules Tweak Makes Electronic Records Harder To Get, Sparks Row

Publication Date: Recent

Source: NDTV

The government has amended election rules to limit public access to certain electronic records, which has raised concerns about transparency in the electoral process.

  • The amendment prevents public inspection of electronic records like CCTV footage and webcasting from polling stations.
  • Officials argue the change is necessary to prevent misuse and protect voter secrecy.
  • Opposition parties claim the amendment erodes the integrity of the electoral process.
  • A court case prompted the amendment, emphasizing the need for clarity regarding what documents are available for public inspection.
  • The amendment only allows access to documents explicitly mentioned in election rules.
“If there was ever a vindication of our assertions regarding the rapidly eroding integrity of the electoral process managed by the Election Commission of India (ECI) in recent times, this is it.” - Jairam Ramesh

This amendment has sparked considerable debate about the balance between election security and public transparency.

item.title: Mumbai Ferry Accident: Missing 7-Year-Old Boy's Body Found Off City Coast; Death Toll Rises To 15 - News18
item.description:
Mumbai Ferry Accident: Missing 7-Year-Old Boy's Body Found, Death Toll Rises to 15

Date: December 21, 2024 Source: News18

The body of a seven-year-old boy who went missing after a ferry capsized off the Mumbai coast was found after a three-day search operation, raising the death toll to 15.

  • A Navy speedboat crashed into the ferry on December 18, leading to the accident.
  • The Navy and Coast Guard conducted extensive search operations for the missing.
  • Of the 113 people on board, 15 have died and 98 were rescued, including two injured.
  • The ferry was overloaded, violating safety regulations.
  • Investigations are underway into the cause of the accident, with a case registered against the driver of the Navy vehicle.
Officials stated, "The Navy has launched a probe into one of the deadliest crashes in the city’s coastal area."

This incident has highlighted serious safety concerns regarding passenger ferries and the enforcement of maritime regulations in India.

item.title: Caught on CCTV: Car flips 8 times on Rajasthan highway, passengers escape unhurt, ask for tea - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Five Passengers Escape Unhurt After SUV Flips Eight Times in Rajasthan

Date: Dec 21, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

In a miraculous escape, five passengers walked away unscathed after their SUV flipped eight times in a freak accident on a highway in Rajasthan's Nagaur district.

  • The SUV was speeding when the driver lost control, causing the vehicle to flip multiple times.
  • Remarkably, none of the passengers sustained injuries despite the severe crash.
  • The incident was captured on CCTV, showing the SUV spiraling out of control before hitting a showroom.
  • After the flip, the passengers calmly entered the showroom and asked for tea.
  • The group was traveling from Nagaur to Bikaner.
“No one was hurt...not even a single scratch. As soon as they entered, they asked for tea,” said an amused official from the showroom.

This incredible incident highlights both the potential dangers of high-speed driving and the resilience of the passengers involved.

item.title: People feared trapped after multi-storey building collapses in Punjab’s Mohali - The Indian Express
item.description:
Multi-storey building collapses in Mohali, Army fears 10-15 trapped in basement

Date: Saturday evening, Source: Indian Express

A multi-storey building collapsed in the Sohana area of Mohali, Punjab, raising concerns that several individuals may be trapped beneath the debris.

  • The building collapsed after excavation work for a nearby basement.
  • The Army has sent two engineering columns to assist in rescue efforts.
  • Estimates suggest that 10-15 people could be trapped in the basement.
  • Rescue operations are ongoing, with local police present at the scene.
  • The local former sarpanch reported that a gym was damaged at the time of the collapse.
“As of now, we do not know what has happened. We are looking if anyone is trapped and urge the administration to expedite the rescue work.” - Parwinder Singh Sohana, former sarpanch

The situation remains critical as the rescue team continues to search for survivors beneath the rubble.

item.title: Man Accidentally Drops iPhone In Temple Box. Why He Won't Get It Back - NDTV
item.description:
Man Accidentally Drops iPhone In Temple Box. Why He Won't Get It Back

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

A man in Tamil Nadu accidentally dropped his iPhone into a temple offerings box and may not be able to recover it, as it is now deemed temple property under local regulations.

  • The man, identified as Dinesh, requested the return of his iPhone from officials at the Sri Kandaswamy temple.
  • The Tamil Nadu Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments department stated that under existing rules, offerings once placed in the hundial cannot be returned.
  • Minister PK Sekar Babu reaffirmed that all offerings belong to the deity of the temple.
  • This is not the first incident; in May 2023, a woman lost a gold chain in a similar manner but was compensated.
“Anything that is deposited into the offering box... goes into God's account.” — PK Sekar Babu

The temple administration's refusal reflects longstanding practices on offerings, and while the minister expressed willingness to discuss compensation, the precedent suggests recovery is unlikely.

item.title: PM Modi meets 101-year-old ex-IFS officer in Kuwait after granddaughter's request - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PM Modi meets 101-year-old ex-IFS officer in Kuwait after granddaughter's request

Date: Dec 21, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi met a 101-year-old former Indian Foreign Service officer in Kuwait after his granddaughter requested a meeting on social media.

  • PM Modi's visit is notable as it is the first by an Indian Prime Minister to Kuwait in 43 years.
  • The meeting was initiated by a social media request from Mangal Sain Handa’s granddaughter.
  • Mangal Sain Handa has a significant legacy as a former IFS officer.
  • Kuwait has a large Indian diaspora, constituting 21% of its total population.
“This is an experience of a lifetime. PM Modi said he especially came here to meet him (my father). We are grateful to Prime Minister Modi.” - Dilip Handa

PM Modi's visit emphasizes the strong ties between India and Kuwait, highlighting historical connections and mutual interests.

item.title: Former Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala cremated with state honours in Sirsa - The Times of India
item.description:
Former Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala cremated with state honours in Sirsa

Publication Date: [Insert Publication Date Here]

Source: [Insert Source Here]

Om Prakash Chautala, the former Chief Minister of Haryana, received a state funeral in Sirsa, attended by dignitaries and political leaders.

  • Chautala's contributions to Haryana during his political career were recognized.
  • State honours were accorded in respect for his long service and impact.
  • His passing was marked by public mourning and tributes.
“His vision for Haryana will be remembered by many.” - [Insert Notable Person’s Name]

The cremation not only served as a farewell but also highlighted Chautala's influence in the region.

item.title: How L-G Nod To Prosecute Arvind Kejriwal Could Impact Delhi Election Game - News18
item.description:
Impact of L-G's Approval to Prosecute Arvind Kejriwal on Delhi Elections

Date: December 21, 2024, Source: News18

Delhi L-G VK Saxena's approval for the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to prosecute former chief minister Arvind Kejriwal heats up the forthcoming Delhi elections, scheduled for February.

  • The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) seeks to frame the prosecution as evidence of BJP's misuse of power against its opponents.
  • BJP presents the approval as proof of Kejriwal's involvement in corruption related to the Delhi excise policy.
  • Congress enters the fray, challenging Kejriwal with its candidate, Sandeep Dikshit, highlighting past evidence against him.
  • The excise case involves allegations of corruption and kickbacks related to the government's excise policy, now scrapped.
  • The political tussle is intensified as both BJP and AAP leverage the corruption narrative ahead of elections.
“If the L-G has given the go-ahead to ED to prosecute, then where is the copy of this? It’s clear this is a rumour.” - Manish Sisodia

As the election approaches, the battle centers on accusations of corruption and misuse of authority, with both AAP and BJP staking their claims for voter support.

item.title: PM Modi keeps promise made on X, meets woman's 101-year-old grandfather in Kuwait - The Times of India
item.description:
PM Modi Keeps Promise Made on X, Meets Woman's 101-Year-Old Grandfather in Kuwait

Publication Date: October 20, 2023, Source: Times of India

In a heartfelt gesture, Prime Minister Narendra Modi fulfilled a promise made on X by meeting the 101-year-old grandfather of a woman who expressed her wish to see Modi during his visit to Kuwait.

  • Modi's visit to Kuwait marked a significant diplomatic engagement.
  • The PM shared a personal moment with the elderly man, emphasizing the importance of connecting with citizens.
  • This meeting highlights Modi's commitment to addressing the sentiments of the Indian diaspora.
“This moment is precious and symbolizes our connection to our elders and our homeland.”

The meeting showcases not only personal connections but also the attention to the Indian community living abroad, aiming to strengthen ties between India and its global citizens.

item.title: Delhi liquor case: BJP calls Kejriwal 'kingpin', AAP cries conspiracy after LG nod on ED action - The Times of India
item.description:
Delhi Liquor Case: BJP Calls Kejriwal 'Kingpin' Amid AAP's Conspiracy Claims

Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

The Delhi liquor case has escalated with the BJP labeling Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal as the 'kingpin' of the alleged scam, while the AAP is decrying this as a conspiracy following the Lieutenant Governor's approval for ED investigations.

  • The BJP claims Kejriwal orchestrated the illicit liquor policy.
  • Deepening confrontation between BJP and AAP amidst ongoing investigations.
  • AAP alleges political vendetta against its leadership.
“This is a political ploy to undermine our administration,” stated an AAP spokesperson.

This ongoing saga highlights rising tensions between the ruling party and the opposition in Delhi, as both sides prepare for heightened political battles over the scandal.

item.title: When PM Modi Fulfilled A Special Request From 101-Year-Old IFS Officer’s Kin In Kuwait - News18
item.description:
PM Modi Meets 101-Year-Old IFS Officer Mangal Sain Handa in Kuwait

Date: December 22, 2024; Source: News18

Prime Minister Modi had a heartfelt meeting with 101-year-old IFS officer Mangal Sain Handa in Kuwait, fulfilling a special request from Handa's family for him to meet the PM during his visit to the Indian diaspora.

  • Mangal Sain Handa served in various countries including Iraq, Kuwait, China, Argentina, the UK, and Cambodia.
  • His granddaughter, Shreya Juneja, reached out to the PM through social media, expressing Handa's admiration and desire to meet him.
  • Responding to the request, PM Modi promised to meet Handa and did so shortly afterward during an event.
  • During the meeting, Handa was seen joyfully interacting with the PM, who inquired about his health and past service.
“You’ve won our hearts once again…Mangal Sain Handa is overjoyed, and his smile means the world to us.” - Shreya Juneja

This event demonstrates PM Modi's engagement with citizens through social media, showcasing how he fosters connections with individuals from various backgrounds.

item.title: ISRO finds new partner in Europe to help with space exploration - Hindustan Times
item.description:
ISRO Collaborates with ESA for Enhanced Space Exploration

Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) and the European Space Agency (ESA) have forged a new collaboration aimed at advancing human space exploration. The two agencies signed a comprehensive agreement on Saturday to cooperate on astronaut training, mission implementation, and a variety of research experiments in space.

  • ISRO and ESA have signed a collaboration agreement for astronaut training and mission implementation.
  • The Axiom-4 mission will be among the first significant projects under this partnership.
  • The agreement covers human and biomedical research, space experiments, and educational outreach.
  • ISRO plans to expand its presence in space with upcoming projects like the Bharatiya Antariksh Station.
  • Both agencies have expressed satisfaction with the progress of the Axiom-4 mission.

Somanath highlighted ISRO's roadmap for human spaceflight, emphasizing the agency’s long-term vision for expanding its presence in space.

This partnership is set to open new avenues for scientific research and technology advancements in space exploration.

item.title: Breaking : No more benefit shows and ticket rate hikes in Telangana - 123telugu
item.description:
No Benefit Shows and Ticket Rate Hikes in Telangana Following Stampede Incident

Published on Dec 21, 2024 by 123Telugu

The Telangana government has decided to halt benefit shows and prevent ticket price increases following a deadly stampede at a movie premiere that caused public outrage and loss of life.

  • The stampede occurred during the Pushpa 2 premiere, resulting in the death of a woman named Revathi and injuring her son.
  • Cinematography Minister Komati Reddy announced the ban on benefit shows and ticket rate hikes.
  • Chief Minister Revanth Reddy emphasized the need to prioritize life over special privileges for the film industry.
  • Actor Allu Arjun was arrested in connection with the incident but quickly gained interim bail from the High Court.
  • The Chief Minister criticized the film industry for their lack of concern for the victims' families.
“After a life is lost, my government decided not to allow any special privileges to the film industry.” – CM Revanth Reddy

This decisive action from the Telangana government underscores the importance of safety in public events and the government's commitment to protect its citizens.

item.title: Day after Andhra woman was delivered body in crate, police on lookout for brother-in-law - The Indian Express
item.description:
Andhra Woman Receives Body in Crate: Police Hunt for Brother-in-Law

Date & Source: December 21, 2024 - Indian Express

Introduction: A woman in Undi, Andhra Pradesh, received a body with a disfigured face in a wooden crate, prompting a police investigation and a search for her brother-in-law.

  • Body Delivery: The body was sent to R Tulasi’s under-construction house, wrapped in plastic sheets within a wooden crate along with electrical wires.
  • Police Investigation: The police are investigating a call made to Tulasi informing her of the parcel delivery.
  • Suspect: C Sridhar alias Varma, Tulasi’s brother-in-law, is the prime suspect and has been absconding since Friday.
  • Note Found: A note claiming that Tulasi’s husband owed Rs 3 lakh, now standing at Rs 1.30 crore with interest, was found.

“This was very carefully planned, the way the body was packed and stuffed in the crate, and how it was ensured that it was delivered to the house. So far, no one from any village has come forward to report their family member or relative missing,” SP Asmi said.

Conclusion: The body has been sent for post-mortem, and the police are continuing their investigation into the identity of the deceased and the motive behind the crime.

item.title: Kerala Lottery Results 21.12.2024: Karunya KR-685 Winners Announced; Full List Here! - News18
item.description:
Kerala Lottery Results: Karunya KR-685 Winners Announced

Date: December 21, 2024, Source: News18

The results of the Kerala Lottery's Karunya KR-685 lucky draw have been announced, revealing significant cash prizes including a top reward of Rs 80 lakh.

  • First prize: KV 829857 (Vadakara) - Rs 80 lakh
  • Second prize: KW 948415 (Thirur) - Rs 5 lakh
  • Third prize: KN 945606 (Thirur) and others - Rs 1 lakh
  • Consolation prizes of Rs 8,000 were awarded to several ticket numbers.
“Winners have 30 days from the draw date to present their winning ticket.”

This lottery continues to be a significant event in Kerala, providing substantial rewards and is followed closely by the public.

item.title: Perpetual Toll Collection Arbitrary; No Entity Can't Be Allowed Unjust Enrichment At Public Cost :... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Rejects Toll Imposition Plea for DND Flyway

Publication Date: 2024

Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court dismissed a plea to impose tolls on Delhi Noida Direct (DND) flyway, emphasizing that no entity should profit unjustly at the cost of public suffering.

  • The Court found the contract with Noida Toll Bridge Company Limited (NTBCL) unfair and inconsistent with Constitutional norms.
  • Public infrastructure projects must serve the public and not merely enrich private entities.
  • NTBCL has already recovered costs and made substantial profits from user fees/tolls.
  • The clause allowing NTBCL to collect user fees indefinitely was deemed opposed to public policy.
  • The Court expressed concern over transparency and fairness in public projects and called for investigations into potential corruption.
“When a state undertakes a project involving an overwhelming public element, comprising of public funds and public assets, its actions must remain free of arbitrariness and remain grounded in a just, transparent and a well-defined policy.”

The ruling reinforces the need for fairness in public infrastructure contracts and highlights the potential misuse of power by officials.

item.title: Couple Threatened And Extorted, Woman Molested At Madhya Pradesh Picnic Spot - NDTV
item.description:
Couple Threatened and Extorted, Woman Molested at Madhya Pradesh Picnic Spot

Date: 28 September 2024 Source: NDTV

In a troubling incident in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district, a young couple was threatened and extorted by a group while on a picnic. A viral video of the event has raised public concern and prompted police action.

  • A couple was caught in a secluded area by a group of individuals.
  • The perpetrators extorted money and molested the woman, as seen in a viral video.
  • The Rewa police have initiated an investigation and are seeking the victims to ensure their safety and confidentiality.
  • Police teams from multiple stations are involved in gathering information.
  • This incident follows a previous attack on a couple near a temple that resulted in severe violence.
“We are actively searching for the victims and appeal to them to come forward. Their identities will be kept confidential, and the culprits will face stringent action.” - Superintendent of Police (SP) Rewa

The incident highlights ongoing concerns about safety in secluded areas and the need for increased vigilance to protect individuals from harassment and violence.

item.title: Amit Shah bitten by ‘rabid dog,’ says Karnataka minister Priyank Kharge amid Ambekar row - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Karnataka Minister Slams Amit Shah, Claims He's 'Bitten by a Rabid Dog' Amid Ambedkar Controversy

Date: Dec 21, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge criticized Union Home Minister Amit Shah during an ongoing controversy related to BR Ambedkar, claiming Shah was “bitten by a rabid dog.”

  • Kharge accused Shah of distorting Ambedkar's legacy and values.
  • He stated that invoking Ambedkar's name is important for achieving social equality.
  • Shah allegedly remarked about the repetitive mention of Ambedkar's name in the Rajya Sabha, equating it to a fashion trend.
  • Kharge emphasized the need for social, political, and economic equality inspired by Ambedkar.
“By chanting the name of Ambedkar in this birth we will get political, social, economic equality and a life of self-esteem.” - Priyank Kharge

This exchange highlights the ongoing political tensions regarding Ambedkar's legacy in India and emphasizes the contrasting ideologies between the ruling party and opposition.

item.title: Wife's Financial Independence No Bar To Grant Alimony If It's Necessary To Secure Dignity & Social... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Grants Permanent Alimony to Secure Financial Independence Post-Divorce

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has ruled that maintenance can be granted even if a party is financially independent, emphasizing the necessity to uphold dignity and financial stability following divorce.

The Court awarded Rs 50 lakhs as permanent alimony to a wife, taking into consideration the length of marriage, earning capacities, and the emotional and financial burdens faced during litigation.

  • The Supreme Court emphasized that financial independence does not negate the need for maintenance.
  • The Court granted Rs 50 lakhs as permanent alimony for dignity and stability.
  • Factors for awarding alimony include marriage duration, earning capacities, and contributions to the marriage.
  • Past case references were made to reinforce the judgment's rationale.
“The financial independence of a party does not preclude the High Court from granting maintenance if it is necessary to secure dignity...”

This ruling reaffirms the position that alimony is essential for post-divorce sustenance while considering the well-being of dependent parties.

item.title: GST Council Meeting Highlights: Nirmala Sitharaman defers decision on insurance tax, sweet popcorn to attract 18% tax - Mint
item.description:
GST Council Meeting Highlights: Nirmala Sitharaman defers decision on insurance tax, sweet popcorn to attract 18% tax

Date: [Insert Publication Date]

Source: [Insert Source]

The 55th GST Council meeting, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, introduced key changes to the taxation framework while deferring decisions regarding GST restructuring for insurance products.

  • Popcorn Taxation: Unpackaged popcorn will attract 5% GST, pre-packaged popcorn a 12% rate, and caramel-coated popcorn will be taxed at 18%.
  • Fortified Rice Kernels: GST rate standardized at 5%, down from 18%.
  • ACC Blocks: GST for blocks with over 50% fly ash reduced to 12% from 18%.
  • Used Cars and EVs: GST increased on the sale of old vehicles to 18% from 12%.
“Some members said more discussions are required. We (GoM) will meet in January again,” - Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Samrat Chaudhary

The Council concluded that further technical discussions are necessary for insurance-related GST changes, postponing any immediate decisions.

item.title: Priyanka Gandhi bristles as BJP MP gifts her 'Sikh genocide' bag - The Times of India
item.description:
Priyanka Gandhi Responds to BJP MP's 'Sikh Genocide' Bag Gift

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Not specified

In a controversial incident, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi expressed her displeasure when a BJP MP presented her with a bag labeled 'Sikh genocide', highlighting the ongoing political tensions in India.

  • The incident took place during a recent political event.
  • Gandhi's reaction was widely covered in news and social media.
  • Political observers noted the implications of such gestures in the context of ongoing communal tensions in the country.
“Such acts only aim to provoke and distract from real issues.”

This incident further escalates the ongoing political discourse around communalism and historical grievances in India.

item.title: Ambedkar row: Amit Shah bitten by 'rabid dog,' says Karnataka minister Priyank Kharge - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge Criticizes Amit Shah's Remarks on Ambedkar

Published: 21 December 2024, 08:50 IST

Karnataka Minister for IT and BT, Priyank Kharge, condemned Union Home Minister Amit Shah's comments regarding B.R. Ambedkar, accusing him of being out of touch with the principles of equality.

  • Kharge stated that Shah has been "bitten by a rabid dog" in his views about Ambedkar.
  • The minister emphasized the importance of Ambedkar's philosophy for achieving political, social, and economic equality.
  • Shah's remarks have stirred controversy, with accusations that the Congress party is misrepresenting his statements.
"The more Ambedkar and Basava philosophy grow, the RSS ideology will diminish." – Priyank Kharge

This exchange highlights ongoing tensions in Indian politics regarding legacy figures like Ambedkar and the interpretation of equality in contemporary discourse.
